title: MSBuild doesn't find targets if parentheses in solution folder names
body:
When I try to build V8 for ArangoDB, two solution files are generated by gyp(?). If I try to build the projects/targets `v8`, `v8_libbase` or `v8_libplatform` by build script or manually, `msbuild` will fail because it can't find the targets:

```
> msbuild all.sln /t:v8
error MSB4057: the target package "v8" does not exist in the project
```

The projects clearly do exist, but they are (for whatever reason) nested in solution folders like this:

```
(tools)
    |_ (gyp)
           |_ v8
```

![project_file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1309249/9360010/223e603c-4694-11e5-83a7-1634f6dac646.png)

Note the brackets `()` in the folder names. If I remove them, `msbuild all.sln /t=tools\gyp\v8` will work!

So nesting is generally supported, but parentheses cause trouble. I couldn't find a way to escape them, and I don't know how to change the sln generator to not nest projects. If I remove the solution folders entirely, `msbuild all.sln /t:v8` will also work.

Solution file: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/39101475/BugReports/all.sln

Maybe somewhere around here escaping or I don't know what needs to be done:

https://github.com/Microsoft/msbuild/blob/master/src/XMakeBuildEngine/BackEnd/Components/RequestBuilder/TargetBuilder.cs#L171

nodes.body:
A workaround:

Use `%28` as the escape of `(` and `%29` as the escape of `)`.
